intro: Papaver nudicaule subsp. nudicaule, commonly known as the meadow poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features striking, bright yellow petals that surround a central cluster of stamens, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
